docs.title: Blue Heaven Rentals
docs.text:
Category: Academic Project | Year: 2024

Blue Heaven Rentals is a university 2nd year group project developed as part of our degree program, focused on simplifying and modernizing the property rental process. The web application is designed to help users easily browse, search, and explore rental properties, while enabling property owners or admins to manage listings efficiently. The project is built using React for a fast and interactive user interface, Tailwind CSS for a clean and responsive design, and Firebase for authentication and real-time data handling. As a collaborative academic project, Blue Heaven Rentals addresses real-world rental management challenges while demonstrating strong teamwork, practical problem-solving, and full-stack web development skills.

Technologies: React, Tailwind CSS, Firebase

Status: LIVE

Live Site: bluehavenrentals.netlify.app

docs.title: Images Directory
docs.text: Place your project screenshots and images here.

docs.title: Usage in Markdown
docs.text:
Reference images using standard Markdown syntax:

![Project Screenshot](images/project-screenshot.png)
![Project Logo](images/project-logo.jpg)

docs.title: Recommended Structure
docs.text:
• images/projects/ - Project screenshots and images
  • images/about/ - Personal photos or team photos
  • images/logos/ - Technology logos or company logos

docs.title: Image Guidelines
docs.text:
• Use descriptive filenames (e.g., ecommerce-dashboard.png)
  • Optimize images for web (recommended formats: PNG, JPG, WebP)
  • Recommended max dimensions: 1920x1080 for screenshots
  • Keep file sizes under 500KB when possible

docs.title: Example Project Image Path
docs.text: ![E-Commerce Platform](images/projects/ecommerce-platform.png)

docs.title: Project Images Directory
docs.text: This directory contains screenshots and images for all portfolio projects.

docs.title: Step 1: Prepare Your Images
docs.text:
1. Image Format: Use JPG, PNG, or WebP format
  2. Recommended Size:
  3. Width: 1200-1920px
  4. Height: Auto (maintain aspect ratio)
  5. File size: Under 500KB (optimize for web)
  6. Image Quality: Use high-quality screenshots that showcase your project well

docs.title: Step 2: Name Your Images
docs.text:
Name your images using the project's slug (lowercase, with hyphens). You can use either .jpg, .png, or .webp extension - just make sure the filename in the markdown matches your actual file.

Here are the expected filenames (use the extension that matches your file):

  • sparkling-car-care.png or sparkling-car-care.jpg

docs.title: Step 3: Place Images in This Folder
docs.text: Simply copy your image files to this directory (docs/images/projects/) with the correct filename.

docs.title: Step 4: Verify
docs.text: The images are already referenced in docs/projects.md. Once you add the image files with the correct names, they will automatically appear on your projects page.

docs.title: Image Optimization Tips
docs.text:
• Use tools like TinyPNG or Squoosh to compress images
  • For screenshots, PNG works well for UI elements, JPG for photos
  • Consider using WebP format for better compression (modern browsers support it)

docs.title: Example
docs.text: If you have a screenshot for "Nebula Arcs": 1. Save it as nebula-arcs.jpg (or .png) 2. Place it in docs/images/projects/nebula-arcs.jpg 3. The image will automatically appear on the projects page!

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Images are optional - if an image file doesn't exist, the placeholder will simply not display
  • All images use the .project-image CSS class for consistent styling
  • Images are responsive and will scale properly on all devices
